answer: The function decorator used to cache functions that return data in Streamlit is @st.cache_data. By decorating a function with @st.cache_data, Streamlit will store the results of slow function calls, making the app faster by running the function only once. This decorator is designed for functions that return data like DataFrames, NumPy arrays, strings, integers, floats, or other serializable types.

This is great for streaming data or monitoring processes. You may want the user to start and stop this live streaming. To do this, programmatically set the run_every parameter for your fragment.

Start and stop a fragment from automatically rerunning.

Sometimes, you may want to trigger a full-script rerun from inside a fragment. To do this, call st.rerun inside the fragment.
